item.title: Using Wright's rules and a DAG to compute the bias of an effect when we measure proxies for X and Y
item.description: This is a skeletal post to work up an answer to a twitter question using Wright’s rules of path models. Using this panel A from this figure fn <- "proxy_dag.jpg" fig_path <- here::here("content/images") knitr::include_graphics(fig_path) the question is I want to know about A->Y but I measure A* and Y*. So in figure A, is the bias the backdoor path from A* to Y* through A and Y? If the data are standardized (everything as unit variance) This is easy and just uses Wright’s rules of adding up effects along a path
